questions.question_text: What three steps must be taken when removing a host from a vSAN-enabled cluster? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
This one is a more recent document 
https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2148975
Remove VMkernel port with vSAN traffic checkbox checked. is not requirement but is good to do it

How to remove a host from your Virtual SAN cluster
Place host in maintenance mode.
Delete disk group when “maintenance mode” is completed.
Move host out of the cluster.
Remove the VSAN VMkernel (not a requirement, but I prefer to clean things up)


http://www.yellow-bricks.com/2014/01/14/remove-host-virtual-san-cluster/

choices.E: Create at least one vSphere Standard Switch.
choices.B: Remove the host from vSAN cluster.
choices.A: Remove VMkernel port with vSAN traffic checkbox checked.
choices.C: Remove disks from diskgroups, remove disk groups.
choices.D: Place the host into maintenance mode with Full Migration option selected.

questions.question_text: What three tools or products can be used for monitoring a vSphere 6.x deployment? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: ABD are correct, Orchestrator allows for the creation of workflows and vCenter Automation runs on top of the stack to create a software defined data-center for networking, blueprints, catalogs, etc.
ABD is the correct answer as vRealize Automation and orchestration have no part in monitoring
A B D correct. Passed with 500/500 today

comments.content: Hi @tarq, is the dump still Valid ?
ABD or ABE? which one is correct?
ABD is 100% correct answer. I also got 500/500. Perhaps you had typo.

discussion.content: ABE is correct. Passed 07 dec 20 with 500/500
I am pretty sure it is ABD.

questions.question_text: Which two resource types can be limited on the vApp level? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The direct console performs the following tests:
* Pings the default gateway
* Pings the primary DNS name server
* Pings the secondary DNS nameserver
* Resolves the configured host name

questions.question_text: Which three IP addresses may be pinged by the Test Management Network feature in the ESXi hosts DCUI? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
A snapshot preserves the following information:

Virtual machine settings. The virtual machine directory, which includes the disks added or changed after you take the snapshot.
Power state. The virtual machine can be powered on, powered off, or suspended.
Disk state. State of all the virtual machine's virtual disks.
(Optional) Memory state. The contents of the virtual machine's memory.
